intro: Amomum laterale, commonly known as wild cardamom, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its rhizomes and leaves are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their distinct fragrance. Amomum laterale thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
